TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OperationCollection extends System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionBaseCollection
Public NotInheritable Class OperationCollection Inherits ServiceDescriptionBaseCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of instances of the class. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> class corresponds to the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) `<operation>` element enclosed by the `<portType>` element. For more information about WSDL, see the [WSDL](https://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/) specification.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the properties and methods exposed by the `OperationCollection` class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Web.Services.Description.Operation operation);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.Services.Description.Operation operation) cil managed
public: void Insert(int index, System::Web::Services::Description::Operation ^ operation);
member this.Insert : int * System.Web.Services.Description.Operation -> unit

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which to insert the parameter.
The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified to the at the specified zero-based index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the number of items in the collection already equals the collection's capacity, the capacity is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If the `index` parameter is equal to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>, the `operation` parameter is added to the end of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationCollection>.
The elements after the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the `Insert` method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Remove (System.Web.Services.Description.Operation operation);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.Services.Description.Operation operation) cil managed
public: void Remove(System::Web::Services::Description::Operation ^ operation);
member this.Remove : System.Web.Services.Description.Operation -> unit

Docs.param: The to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the first occurrence of the specified from the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
The elements that follow the removed <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation> move up to occupy the vacated spot.
